page.title: 02Daresbury Hall
page.content: Daresbury Hall House was built in 1748 which was in the Georgian Period. It was a family house owned by the Greenall family for a time. The Hill family was the last family to live there. After that it was sold back to Greenall Whitley in the early 1950's but they did not live in it. In 1952 the Spastic Society formed with four parents paying Â£5 each to the society. In 1957 the society bought it for Â£5,000. In 1959 the first residents came that were physically handicapped. One year later it was officially opened. There are 52 residents and 75 members of staff. The residents do weaving, basket work, gardening, art and sporting activities. They sometimes have to do Maths and English and can produce some good pictures. It costs Â£12,500 for each resident so a lot of money has to be raised yearly.
